Data.event_text: A speedboat carrying at least 39 people capsized near the shoreline in Tarakan, North Kalimantan. It reportedly struck a tree prior to its sinking. At least 31 people were rescued and 8 others were killed in the accident.

links.text: -Hidayat, Faiq (January 1, 2018). "Insiden Maut Speedboat Tabrak Pohon, 31 Penumpang Diselamatkan". Detik. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 31 people suffered food poisoning due to consumption of contaminated tapai in Purwakarta, West Java.

links.text: -Ispranoto, Tri (January 1, 2018). "31 Warga Purwakarta Keracunan Tape, Satu Orang Tewas". Detik. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: More than 30 elementary schools students in Bandung suffered food poisoning after consuming contaminated street foods.

links.text: -Ramadhan, Dony Indra (January 11, 2018). "35 Anak SD di Bandung Keracunan Jajanan". Detik. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Regent of Talaud Islands Regency Sri Wahyu was deactivated from duty for at least three months due to unauthorized trips to the United States.

links.text: -Ramdhani, Jabbar (January 12, 2018). "2 Kali ke AS Tanpa Izin, Bupati Talaud Sri Wahyuni Dinonaktifkan". Detik. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A mezzanine floor collapses at the Indonesia Stock Exchange building, injuring 77 people.

links.text: -"Jakarta stock exchange walkway collapses". BBC News. January 15, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Jakarta's Maritime Museum in North Jakarta caught fire, workers and visitors in the museum were evacuated. No casualties.

links.text: -"Maritime Museum catches fire on Tuesday morning".-

Data.event_text: A measles outbreak was declared in Asmat, Papua. Further investigation revealed that multiple families had suffered from malnutrition.

links.text: -Perdana, Aretyo Jevon (January 16, 2018). "KLB Campak di Asmat, Kemenkes RI Kirim 39 Tenaga Medis". Liputan6. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Government officials were targeted with harsh criticism after the revelation of mass malnutrition among Asmat tribe, prompting public outcry and protests.

links.text: -Abdulsalam, Husein (January 28, 2018). Sugito, Zen Rachmat (ed.). "Mengeksploitasi Asmat: Hutan, Budaya, dan Akhirnya Gizi Buruk". Tirto. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian President Jokowi reshuffles cabinet.

links.text: -Chan, Francis (January 17, 2018). "Indonesian president Jokowi reshuffles Cabinet, appoints Golkar sec-gen, former military chief". The Straits Times.-

Data.event_text: Minister of Social Affairs Khofifah Indar Parawansa sent her resignation letter after she stated that she would enter the race for the 2018 Indonesian local elections as the governor of East Java.

A magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck the southern coast of Java. The epicenter of the quake was near Lebak, Banten at depth of about 60 km. Two people died of heart attacks and 32 were injured. Hundreds of buildings including dozens in the capital Jakarta were damaged.

links.text: -Kirby, Will (January 23, 2018). "Indonesia earthquake: 130 buildings damaged as 6.1 quake rocks Java – 8 children injured". The Express.-

Data.event_text: The Argo Parahyangan executive train traveling from Jakarta jumped the railway track as it entered Bandung station. No fatalities or injured in incident.

links.text: -"Island focus: Train jumps railway tracks in Bandung".-

Data.event_text: At least 25 houses were damaged after freak tides struck Sukabumi, West Java.

links.text: -Alamsyah, Syahdan (January 29, 2018). "25 Rumah Warung Diterjang Gelombang Pasang Pantai Citepus Sukabumi". Detik.-

Data.event_text: Former actor and Governor of Jambi Zumi Zola was arrested by the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) due to suspected gratification of several projects in Jambi worth of Rp 6 billion rupiah.

links.text: -Rozie, Fachrur (April 9, 2018). "Perjalanan Kasus Zumi Zola hingga Ditahan KPK". Liputan6. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Regent of Jombang, Nyono, was arrested by KPK due to suspicion of corruption.

links.text: -Hidayat, Faiq (February 3, 2018). "Kena OTT KPK, Bupati Jombang Nyono Diduga Terima Sejumlah Uang". Detik.-

Data.event_text: At least 4 construction workers were killed after a crane collapse in Jatinegara, Jakarta.

links.text: -Antony, Noval Dhwinuari (February 4, 2018). "4 Orang Tewas, Ini Kronologi Ambruknya Crane DDT di Jatinegara". Detik. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Regional Disaster Mitigation Agency of Yogyakarta reported that at least 11 sinkholes were detected in Gunungkidul.

links.text: -Hadi, Usman (February 7, 2018). "BPBD Catat Ada 11 Lubang Misterius yang Muncul di Gunungkidul". Detik.-

Data.event_text: Governor of West Java, Ahmad Heryawan, declared a state of emergency for the province due to threats of landslides and floods.

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (February 6, 2018). "Pemprov Jabar Tetapkan Siaga Darurat Bencana hingga 31 Mei". Detik.-

Data.event_text: At least 16 houses were damaged after a tornado struck a village in Mojokerto.

links.text: -Budianto, Enggran Eko (February 9, 2018). "Angin Kencang Porak Porandakan 16 Rumah di Mojokerto". Detik.-

Data.event_text: At least 27 people have died after a bus plunged from a hill on West Java. 18 other people were injured.

links.text: -"Dozens dead after coach plunges from hill in Indonesia". Independent.co.uk. February 10, 2018. Archived from the original on May 1, 2022.-
-"Dozens dead after coach plunges from hill in Indonesia". Independent.co.uk. February 10, 2018. Archived from the original on May 1, 2022.-

Data.event_text: National Narcotics Board (BNN) seized a Singaporean vessel in Philips Strait after the vessel allegedly carried 1.1 tonnes of methamphetamine.

links.text: -Amelia, Mei (February 10, 2018). "BNN: Kapal Sunrise Glory Sempat Drop 1 Ton Sabu di Australia". Detik. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: KPK announced that 19 government officials, including members of Central Lampung Regional House of Representatives and the Regent of Central Lampung Regency, Mustafa, were arrested for allegations of bribery of a project worth Rp 300 million rupiah in Lampung.

links.text: -Fatmawati, Nur Indah (February 15, 2018). "Begini Kronologi OTT Suap DPRD Lampung Tengah". Detik.-

Data.event_text: General Elections Commission (KPU) declared that 4 newly formed political parties have qualified for the 2019 Indonesia General Elections.

links.text: -"Four new parties to take part in 2019 elections". Jakarta Post. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: KPU officially draws the number of each political parties for the 2019 election.

links.text: -Zafna, Grandyos (February 18, 2018). "Catat, Ini Nomor Urut 14 Parpol di Pemilu 2019". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Mount Sinabung erupted, spewing ash 5 km into the sky. At least 4 districts were affected due to the eruption.

links.text: -Santama, Jefris (February 19, 2018). "Gunung Sinabung Semburkan Abu Vulkanik 5 Km, 4 Kecamatan Terdampak". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least nine people have been killed and 13 are still missing after a landslide cascaded down the terraced slopes of a rice field on Brebes, Central Java.
Indonesian Police arrested 28 crew members of a Taiwanese vessel which reportedly carried methamphetamine.

links.text: -Ramdhani, Jabbar (February 23, 2018). "Polri Periksa 28 ABK Kapal yang Ditangkap di Kepri". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Commissioner of the General Elections Commission of Garut was arrested by KPK due to allegations of bribery.

links.text: -Ramadhan, Dony Indra (February 24, 2018). "Diduga Terima Suap, Komisioner KPU dan Ketua Panwaslu Garut Ditangkap". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: An 80 meter long cracks caused panic among residents in Banjarnegara, sparking evacuation.

links.text: -Hartono, Uje (February 24, 2018). "Tanah Retak 80 Meter, Ratusan Warga Banjarnegara Mengungsi". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A Rp3.5 trillion rupiah yacht, named Equinimity, was seized by the Indonesian National Police and FBI after international investigation concluded that the owners were involved in 1MDB case.

links.text: -"Indonesia hands over 1MDB-linked luxury yacht to FBI: police". The Jakarta Post. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Mayor of Kendari, Adriatma Dwi Putra, was arrested by the Corruption Eradication Commission for alleged bribery.

links.text: -Saputra, Ari (March 1, 2018). "Wali Kota Kendari Ditahan KPK, Pendukung Histeris". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 62 people were treated for food poisoning after allegedly consuming contaminated food from a wedding.

links.text: -Putra, Wisma (March 7, 2018). "Keracunan Makanan, 62 Warga Kampung Cikancung Dilarikan ke Dua RS". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A boat carrying 11 santri capsized after being struck by multiple high waves near Sapeken Island. At least 2 people were killed.

links.text: -Wahyudiyanta, Imam (March 8, 2018). "Perahu Terhantam Ombak di Sapeken, Berikut Kronologinya". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Acting Speaker of the Indonesian House of Representatives Fadli Zon reported Secretary General of Indonesian Solidarity Party (PSI) and activist Faisal Assegaf to the police for disinformation.

links.text: -Matondang, Denita (March 9, 2018). "Fadli Zon Polisikan Sekjen PSI Raja Juli Antoni dan Faisal Assegaf". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 2 people were killed after an accident involving an M113 APC in Purworejo.

links.text: -Damarjati, Danu (March 10, 2018). "Kostrad: Tank M113 Terperosok Akibat Dasar Sungai Bogowonto Tak Kokoh". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: In line with international regulations, the Indonesian Ministry of Transportation issued an announcement to ban passengers from bringing battery charger into the cabin of an aircraft.

links.text: -Kholid, Idham (March 12, 2018). "Kemenhub Larang Powerbank Berdaya Besar Masuk Pesawat, Ini Aturannya". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian Supreme Court put a judge from Tangerang High Court on administrative leave due to alleged bribery.

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (March 13, 2018). "MA Nonaktifkan Hakim PN Tangerang yang Jadi Tersangka Suap". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) announced that a candidate for governor of North Maluku Ahmad Mus was declared as a suspect in an airport corruption case.

links.text: -Fatmawati, Nur Indah (March 16, 2018). "KPK Umumkan Cagub Malut Ahmad Mus Tersangka Korupsi Lahan Bandara". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian Ministry of Agriculture assured that a viral video claiming "fake eggs" in Indonesia was a hoax.

links.text: -Lestari, Mustiana (March 18, 2018). "Kementan Tegaskan Info Telur Palsu Hoax". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Fierce backlash after Prabowo Subianto made a speech of Indonesia breaking apart in 2030.

links.text: -Nugroho, Bagus Prihantoro (March 19, 2018). "Ini Pidato Prabowo Soal Prediksi Indonesia Bubar Tahun 2030". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A propeller aircraft crashed while performing an aerobatic show in Cilacap. The sole occupant of the aircraft, the pilot, was killed in the accident.

links.text: -Ariefana, Pebriansyah (March 20, 2018). "Pesawat Aerobatik Jatuh di Cilacap, Pilot Tewas". Suara. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 600 hectares of crops were damaged or destroyed due to toxic fumes from Ijen crater.

links.text: -Widarsha, Chuk (March 24, 2018). "600 Hektare Lahan Terimbas Gas Beracun Kawah Ijen, Tanaman Menguning". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Former Speaker of the Indonesian House of Representatives Setya Novanto was charged with 16 years in prison due to the corruption of at least US$7.3 million in the E-KTP case.

links.text: -Mardiastuti, Aditya (March 29, 2018). "Dituntut 16 Tahun Bui, Novanto Tetap Bantah Terima Duit e-KTP". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: More than 1,200 people were displaced after a massive inferno tore through densely-populated residential area in West Jakarta.

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (March 30, 2018). "Kebakaran di Taman Kota, 1.252 Jiwa Kehilangan Tempat Tinggal". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 2 people were killed after two landing craft tank vessels collided off the coast of Balikpapan, East Kalimantan.

links.text: -Rosadi, Saud (March 31, 2018). "Kapal Terbakar di Perairan Teluk Balikpapan, 2 Orang Tewas" (in Indonesian). Liputan6. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Daughter of former Indonesian president, President Sukarno, Sukmawati Sukarnoputri, was reported to the police for her Ibu Indonesia poem.

links.text: -Rizqo, Kanavino Ahmad (April 3, 2018). "Kontroversi Puisi Sukmawati yang Berujung Laporan Polisi". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Indonesian Agency for the Assessment and Application of Technology (BPPT) issued a warning of a possible 57 meters tsunami in Pandeglang in the future.

links.text: -Matondang, Denita (April 3, 2018). "Riset Pemodelan BPPT, Ada Potensi Tsunami 57 Meter di Pandeglang". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 1 person was killed after a train collided with a truck in Ngawi, East Java.

links.text: -Harianto, Sugeng (April 7, 2018). "Evakuasi KA Sancaka Belum Tuntas Malam Ini, Tunggu Alat Berat". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Prabowo Subianto announced his bid as a presidential candidate for the 2019 Indonesian general elections.

links.text: -Maharani, Tsarina (April 11, 2018). "Ini Pernyataan Lengkap Prabowo Siap Nyapres". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A total of 42 people died due to the consumption of bootleg liquor in West Java.

links.text: -Putra, Wisma (April 12, 2018). "Nyawa Siswa SMP Tak Tertolong, Korban Miras Maut Jadi 42 Orang". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A wall collapsed onto students who were practicing gamelan in Cirebon. At least 7 students were crushed to their deaths.

links.text: -Wamad, Sudirman (April 16, 2018). "Gudang Walet Runtuh Timpa Sanggar Seni Cirebon, 7 Orang Tewas". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A magnitude 4.4 earthquake struck Banjarnegara Regency in Central Java. At least 3 people were killed and more than 300 structures were damaged. At least 27 people were injured by the quake.

links.text: -Halik, Aichi (April 19, 2018). "Gempa Banjarnegara, 3 Tewas 316 Rumah Rusak". Berita Satu. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Seven Banyuwangi residents died after drinking bootleg liquor.

links.text: -Fanani, Ardian (April 20, 2018). "7 Orang Meninggal, Bupati Anas: Awasi Peredaran Miras Oplosan". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Former Speaker of the Indonesian House of Representatives Setya Novanto was sentenced to 15 years in prison after judges found Novanto guilty in e-KTP corruption case.

links.text: -Hidayat, Faiq; Fadhil, Haris (April 24, 2018). "Terbukti Korupsi e-KTP, Setya Novanto Divonis 15 Tahun Penjara". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 47 houses and 2 campus buildings were damaged after a tornado struck Yogyakarta.

links.text: -Hanafi, Ristu (April 24, 2018). "BPBD DIY: 47 Rumah dan 2 Kampus Terdampak Puting Beliung". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: 25 April  At least 28 people were killed and 30 people were injured after an oil well explosion in East Aceh.

links.text: -"Jumlah Korban Meninggal Akibat Ledakan Sumur Minyak Ranto Peureulak Capai 28 Orang". Tribun News. Retrieved March 8, 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2018 Mako Brimob standoff  At least 5 police officers were killed after a standoff in Mako Brimob. There were reports of multiple shootings inside the complex. The incident was regarded as a terrorist attack and the deadliest terrorist attack on police officers in Indonesia.

links.text: -Komara, Indra (May 9, 2018). "5 Polisi Gugur di Mako Brimob Saat Baku Tembak dengan Napi Teroris". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A phreatic eruption occurred on Mount Merapi. The eruption spewed ash as high as 5 km into the sky.

links.text: -Damanik, Caroline (May 11, 2018). Assifa, Farid (ed.). "Gunung Merapi Kembali Meletus". Kompas. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Three churches across Surabaya were attacked by suicide bombers. A total of 15 people were killed in the blasts and dozens more were wounded in the attack. The perpetrators were identified as a family from Surabaya.

links.text: -Sarwanto, Abi (May 14, 2018). "Korban Tewas Teror Bom Surabaya 28 Orang, 57 Luka". nasional (in Indonesian). Retrieved May 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: On the evening, a bomb exploded inside an apartment complex near Surabaya, killing 3 people and wounded 3 others. The victims were terrorists and the blast was deemed as accidental. They planned to detonate the bomb the next day in churches.

links.text: -Candi, Suryaman (May 13, 2018). "Saksi Bom GKI Surabaya: Pelaku 1 Ibu, 2 Anak dan 1 Remaja". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved May 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: On the morning of , the Surabaya Police Headquarters was attacked by a family of suicide bombers. They detonated the bombs while they were being stopped by policemen. 10 people were wounded in the attack.

links.text: -Haryanto, Andry (May 14, 2018). "10 Korban Luka Bom Polrestabes Surabaya, 4 Polisi dan 6 Warga". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved May 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: In response to the terrorist attacks in Mako Brimob and in Surabaya, Indonesian police conducted multiple crackdowns on suspected terrorists throughout Indonesia

links.text: -Rachman, Anita (May 22, 2018). "Indonesian Police Kill 14 Terror Suspects in Crackdown Following Suicide Bombings". Wall Street Journal. ISSN 0099-9660. Retrieved May 23, 2023.-
-Rachman, Anita (May 22, 2018). "Indonesian Police Kill 14 Terror Suspects in Crackdown Following Suicide Bombings". Wall Street Journal. ISSN 0099-9660. Retrieved May 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: At least 5 people, including 4 terrorists, were killed in an attack on a police station in Riau, Another 4 people, including journalists, were injured in the attack.

links.text: -Santoso, Audrey (May 16, 2018). "Serangan di Polda Riau: 1 Polisi Gugur, 4 Teroris Tewas, 4 Terluka". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian extremist Aman Abdurrahman was sentenced to death for creating the extremist group Jamaah Ansharut Daulat (JAD), which was responsible for multiple terrorist attacks in the past two years.

links.text: -Putri, Zunita Amalia (May 18, 2018). "Rentetan Teror yang Buat Aman Abdurrahman Dituntut Mati". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 12 people were killed after a truck ploughed into crowd of people in Brebes, Central Java.

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (May 20, 2018). "Korban Tewas Kecelakaan Truk di Brebes Jadi 12 Orang, 9 Luka". Detik. Retrieved January 26, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Hundreds evacuated after another phreatic eruption on Mount Merapi.

links.text: -Hanafi, Ristu (May 21, 2018). "Merapi Erupsi Freatik, Ratusan Warga di Sleman Mengungsi". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Kertajati International Airport, the largest international airport in West Java, was officially opened by Joko Widodo.

links.text: -"Resmikan Bandara Kertajati, Jokowi: Terima Kasih Pak SBY". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: In response to the multiple terrorist attacks across Indonesia in the past few days, the Indonesian House of Representatives passed a new stronger and tighter anti-terrorism law. The law will grant law enforcers and the Indonesian military more power to conduct anti-terrorism operation.

links.text: -Ramadhani, Nurul Fitri (May 25, 2018). "BREAKING: Indonesia passes stronger antiterrorism law". The Jakarta Post. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 8 people were killed after a fire tore through a boarding house in Surabaya.

links.text: -Rinanda, Hilda Meilisa (May 30, 2018). "8 Korban Kebakaran Kos yang Tewas Belum Rampung Diidentifikasi". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Minister of Law, Justice and Human Rights Yasonna Laoly held a discussion with Minister of Foreign Affairs Retno Marsudi after reports indicated that the government of Israel will ban Indonesians from entering the country.

links.text: -"5 Hal yang Perlu Diketahui Soal Israel Larang Masuk Turis Indonesia". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Regent of Purbalingga, Tasdi, was arrested for a corruption case on an Islamic Center project.

links.text: -Anugrah, Arbi (June 5, 2018). "Bupati Purbalingga Ditangkap, Diduga Terkait Proyek Islamic Center". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A motorist was killed on Jakarta  Cikampek toll road after a large rock was thrown from a pedestrian bridge located above the toll onto cars underneath the bridge. At least one person was arrested due to the incident.

links.text: -Amelia, Mei; Mawardi, Isal (June 8, 2018). "Teror Batu Maut di Tol Jakarta-Cikampek". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesia was chosen as one of the non-permanent members of the United Nations Security Council, the fourth time in Indonesian history.

links.text: -Christiastuti, Novi (June 9, 2018). "Jadi Anggota Tak Tetap DK PBB, Keempat Kalinya Bagi Indonesia". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 13 people were killed after a boat capsized off the coast of Makassar. Authorities suspected that overcapacity caused the vessel to capsize.

links.text: -Soplantila, Reinhard (June 13, 2018). "Kapal Tenggelam di Makassar, 13 Orang Meninggal". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian police announced that at least 110 suspected terrorists had been arrested.

links.text: -Jordan, Ray (June 15, 2018). "Total 110 Orang Terduga Teroris Terkait Teror Surabaya Ditangkap". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: An overloaded ferry carrying 188 people and 50 vehicles capsized in Lake Toba, North Sumatra. 21 people survived the disaster while 3 people were confirmed dead. More than 160 people were missing and presumed dead. It remains as one of the deadliest ferry disaster in Indonesian history.

links.text: -Hartini, Desy (June 20, 2018). "Kapal Tenggelam di Danau Toba, 188 Orang Masih Hilang". KOMPAS.tv (in Indonesian). Retrieved May 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: Mastermind of the 2016 Jakarta attacks, Aman Abdurrahman, was sentenced to death.

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (June 22, 2018). "Aman Abdurrahman Divonis Hukuman Mati". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Ministry of Education and Culture announced that, on the next school year, schools will start applying zonasi (zone) system for the national student enrollment program.

links.text: -Putri, Zunita Amalia (June 25, 2018). "PPDB Pakai Sistem Zonasi agar Sekolah Dekat Keluarga". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian National Police stated that a plane carrying logistics for local elections was shot by militiamen in Papua, injuring a pilot.

links.text: -Putri, Zunita Amalia (June 25, 2018). "Pesawat Pembawa Logistik Pilkada Ditembak, Ini Penjelasan Kapolri". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesia held the 2018 Indonesian local elections. Voters elected 17 governors, 39 mayors and 115 regents across the country.

links.text: -Prasetia, Andhika (April 20, 2017). "Ini 171 Daerah yang Gelar Pilkada Serentak 27 Juni 2018". detiknews (in Indonesian). Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: President Joko Widodo welcomed Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad at the Bogor Palace. The two leaders exploring issues ranging from education for Indonesian children in Malaysia to border negotiations.

links.text: -"Jokowi, Mahathir discuss migrant worker protection, border settlement". The Jakarta Post. June 29, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian Constitutional Court rejected plans to legalize online ojek.

links.text: -"MK Tolak Gugatan Tukang Ojek, Ojol Tetap Ilegal". Okezone. June 29, 2018. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 5 Indonesians were killed after two speedboats collided near Nunukan, North Kalimantan.

links.text: -Batubara, Herianto (June 30, 2018). "Ini Data WNI Korban Tewas Tabrakan Speedboat di Perbatasan Malaysia". Detik. Retrieved January 27, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Democratic Party of Indonesia stated that the party is considering to form a new third coalition for the 2019 Indonesian general elections.

links.text: -Solehudin, Mochamad (July 3, 2018). "Rapat Konsolidasi di Jabar, PD Serius Godok Poros Ketiga Pilpres". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: MV Lestari Maju crashed onto reefs off the shore of thu Selayar Islands, killing 35 people.

links.text: -"Tragedi KM Lestari Maju Tenggelam di Selayar". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A low-explosive bomb exploded inside a house in Pasuruan, East Java. No one was killed in the failed terror attack, but a 6 year old kid had to be brought to the hospital due to explosion injury.

links.text: -Nadlir, Mohammad (July 6, 2018). Meiliana, Diamanty (ed.). "Bom Pasuruan Tergolong Low Eksplosif karena Campuran Mercon". Kompas. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 3 people were killed after a fire tore through the office of the Indonesian Ministry of Transportation. A total of 20 survivors were reported.

links.text: -Linawati, Mevi; Rozie, Fachrur (July 9, 2018). "5 Fakta Pilu Kebakaran di Kemenhub yang Tewaskan 3 Orang". Liputan6. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A failed terrorist attack occurred at a police station in Indramayu, West Java. A couple threw a pressure-cooker bomb into a guarding post in the station. The bomb failed to explode. No one was harmed in the incident.

links.text: -Ramadhan, Dony Indra (July 15, 2018). "Detik-detik Pasutri Bawa Bom Panci Terobos Mapolres Indramayu". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 292 crocodiles were killed by 400 people of Sorong, West Papua after a crocodile preyed upon a local resident.

links.text: -Damarjati, Danu (July 15, 2018). "Sebelum Bantai 292 Buaya, Warga Pertanyakan Izin Penangkaran". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 7 sailors were killed after high waves capsized their boat off the coast of Jember, East Java.

links.text: -Permana, Okky Budi (July 19, 2018). "Kapal Nelayan Dihantam Ombak di Jember, 6 Orang Tewas". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: KPK arrested the Head of Sukamiskin Penitentiary due to alleged extortion.

links.text: -"KPK OTT Kalapas Sukamiskin, Ini Temuan Pungli di Penjara". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck the Indonesian island of Lombok, killing 20 people and injuring dozens. Hundreds of hikers were trapped in Mount Rinjani after multiple landslides and rockfalls occurred after the quake.

links.text: -"Korban Jiwa Gempa Lombok Bertambah Jadi 20 Orang". liputan6.com (in Indonesian). August 5, 2018. Retrieved May 23, 2023.-
-Septarini, Eka Chandra (July 29, 2018). "Gempa Lombok, 826 Wisatawan di Sembalun Menunggu Evakuasi". Bisnis.com (in Indonesian). Retrieved May 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: The Regional Board for Disaster Mitigation recorded a total damage of Rp7.2 billion across 24 beaches in 3 regencies after multiple high waves destroyed stall, structures and boats.

links.text: -Raharjo, Edzan (August 1, 2018). "BPBD: Kerugian Akibat Gelombang Tinggi di DIY Capai Rp 7,2 M". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Palembang LRT began operations in preparation for the 2018 Asian Games, making it the first light rail transit system to operate in Indonesia.

A major 6.9 earthquake struck the island of Lombok. Widespread destruction were reported across multiple regencies in Lombok and Bali. At least 560 deaths and a total damage of 8.8 trillion rupiah were reported, making it one of strongest, deadliest, and most destructive earthquake to have ever hit Lombok.

links.text: -Wirayani, Prima (August 20, 2018). "Gempa 6,9 SR Kembali Mengguncang Lombok". CNBC Indonesia (in Indonesian). Retrieved May 23, 2023.-
-Akbar, Caesar (August 27, 2018). Silaban, Martha Warta (ed.). "Kerugian dan Kerusakan Akibat Gempa Lombok Capai Rp 8,8 Triliun". Tempo. Retrieved May 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: Pro-Jokowi coalition announced that they have appointed 225 spokesperson for Joko Widodo's presidential campaign.

links.text: -Erwanti, Marlinda Oktavia (August 6, 2018). "Koalisi Jokowi Siapkan 225 Jubir, Ada Pemain Bertahan dan Penyerang". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Vice Secretary General of the Democratic Party Andi Arief accused the Great Indonesia Movement Party (Gerindra) of asking Sandiaga Uno to pay Rp500 billion rupiah so that he could be a vice presidential candidate for Prabowo Subianto. Arief accused Prabowo Subianto as "General Cardboard" (Indonesian Jenderal Kardus), thereby destroying any hopes for a coalition between the two major party.

links.text: -"Gerindra Bantah Sandi Bayar PAN-PKS Rp 500 M". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: President Joko Widodo chose Ma'ruf Amin as his vice presidential candidate for the 2019 general elections.

links.text: -Sinintya, Wangi (August 9, 2018). "Alasan Jokowi Gandeng Ma'ruf Amin: Nasionalis-Religius". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Later at night, at a different location, Prabowo Subianto chose Sandiaga Uno as his vice presidential candidate for the 2019 general elections.

links.text: -Tamtomo, Akbar Bhayu (August 10, 2018). Wedhaswary, Inggried Dwi (ed.). "INFOGRAFIK: Prabowo Subianto Pilih Sandiaga Uno". Kompas. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 6 people were killed after a strong aftershock struck Lombok, West Nusa Tenggara.

links.text: -"Gempa kembali guncang Lombok: 'Warga panik, plafon hotel runtuh...'". BBC Indonesia. August 9, 2018. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Sandiaga Uno announced that he has sent his resignation letter as Vice Governor of Jakarta to Anies Baswedan.

links.text: -"Sandi Sudah Kirim Surat Pengunduran Diri ke Jokowi Lewat Anies". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A Dimonim Air Pilatus PC-6 Porter carrying 9 passengers and crew members crashed into a forested terrain in Papua, killing all but one.

links.text: -Idhom, Addi Mawahibun, ed. (August 12, 2018). "Pesawat Dimonim Air yang Jatuh di Papua Ditemukan, 8 Orang Tewas". Tirto. Retrieved May 7, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 11 members of a fictional kingdom called the "Kingdom of the Jellyfishes" were arrested by the Indonesian police.

links.text: -Rifa'i, Bahtiar (August 14, 2018). "Polisi Evakuasi 11 Anggota Kerajaan Ubur-ubur". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Minister of Administrative and Bureaucratic Reform Asman Abnur announced that he has stepped down from his position.

links.text: -Sugianto, Danang (August 14, 2018). "Mundur dari MenPAN-RB, Asman Abnur Berharap Jadi Anggota DPR". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: President Joko Widodo and Vice President Jusuf Kalla officially opened the 2018 Asian Games in Jakarta.

links.text: -Jordan, Ray (August 18, 2018). "Jokowi Resmi Buka Asian Games 2018". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 14 people were killed and 24 people were wounded after a strong magnitude 6.9 earthquake struck the island of Lombok.

links.text: -Antony, Noval Dhwinuari (August 19, 2018). "Gempa 7.0 SR di Lombok Terasa di Bima, Warga Lari ke Tempat Tinggi". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Meiliana, a resident from Tanjungbalai, was sentenced to 18 months in prison after complaining about the loud volume of a call for prayers from nearby mosque. The sentencing caused concern among the public.

links.text: -"Dipertanyakan, vonis 18 bulan penjara bagi Meiliana yang keluhkan volume azan". BBC News Indonesia. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Minister of Social Affairs Idrus Marham resigned from his position after allegations of corruption.

links.text: -Kusuma, Satria (August 24, 2018). "Idrus Marham: Saya Mundur untuk Jaga Kehormatan Jokowi". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita was immediately appointed as the new Minister of Social Affairs after Marham's resignation.

links.text: -"Agus Gumiwang Dilantik Jadi Mensos". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesia reached the 4th spot among every nations that participated in 2018 Asian Games, with a total of 31 gold medals, 24 silver medals and 43 bronze medals.

links.text: -Wibowo, Kris Fathoni (September 1, 2018). "Perolehan Medali Indonesia dan Klasemen Asian Games 2018". Detik. Retrieved January 29, 2021.-

Data.event_text: KPK arrested 22 members of Malang House of Representatives after allegations of bribery and gratification.

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (September 3, 2018). "KPK Tahan 22 Anggota DPRD Malang Tersangka Suap dan Gratifikasi". Detik. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 600 kiosks were destroyed after a massive fire tore through Bandung's infamous Gedebage market.

links.text: -Ramadhan, Dony Indra (September 3, 2018). "Kebakaran Pasar Gedebage Bandung, 600 Kios Hangus". Detik. Retrieved January 16, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A microlight plane carrying Indonesian singer Erix Soekamti crashed in Gunungkidul, Yogyakarta. Both Erix and the pilot survived the crash.

links.text: -Hanafi, Ristu (September 4, 2018). "Pesawat yang Diawakinya Jatuh, Begini Kondisi Erix Soekamti Saat Ini" (in Indonesian). Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Erick Thohir was chosen as the Chief Campaign Manager of presidential candidate Joko Widodo.

links.text: -Hidayat, Faiq; Ikhsanudin, Arief (September 5, 2018). "Erick Thohir Jadi Ketua Timses Jokowi-Ma'ruf Amin" (in Indonesian). Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 21 people were killed after a bus carrying 38 people fell into a ravine in Sukabumi, West Java.

links.text: -Alamsyah, Syahdan (September 8, 2018). "Insiden Bus Maut di Sukabumi Bermuatan 38 Orang Asal Bogor" (in Indonesian). Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Presidential candidate Prabowo Subianto and Sandiaga Uno chose "Koalisi Indonesia Adil Makmur" as the candidates' alliance name.

links.text: -Putri, Zunita (September 18, 2018). "Nama Koalisi Prabowo-Sandi: Koalisi Indonesia Adil Makmur". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Former Indonesian Army General Djoko Santoso was chosen as the Chief Campaign Manager of presidential candidate Prabowo Subianto.

links.text: -Putri, Zunita (September 18, 2018). "Djoko Santoso Ketua Timses Prabowo, Diumumkan 20 September". Detik. Retrieved January 17, 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2018 Sulawesi earthquake and tsunami  A powerful magnitude 7.4 supershear earthquake struck the Indonesian province of Central Sulawesi, producing tsunami waves reaching as high as 13 meters and causing widespread destruction in cities and regencies in Central Sulawesi. Landslides, rockfalls, tsunamis, and major soil liquefactions, which caused hundreds of deaths in the provincial capital Palu, were reported across the province. More than 4,000 people were killed in the disaster in what was described as Central Sulawesi's deadliest disaster in Indonesian history.

links.text: -"Inside Indonesia's disaster-hit airport". BBC News. Retrieved October 4, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Minister of Home Affairs Tjahjo Kumolo ordered to halt all forms of political campaign in Central Sulawesi after a massive earthquake had struck the region.

links.text: -Andayani, Dwi (October 1, 2018). "Kata Bawaslu soal Kampanye Disetop Sementara di Sulteng". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Prabowo Subianto stated that he will send volunteers to Central Sulawesi to assist with the relief efforts.

links.text: -Komara, Indra (October 1, 2018). "Bantu Pemerintah, Prabowo Siap Turunkan Relawan ke Sulawesi Tengah". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Prominent human rights activist and member of Prabowo Subianto's presidential campaign team Ratna Sarumpaet claimed to have been assaulted by three unidentified men in Bandung.

links.text: -Retaduari, Elza Astari; Ramadhan, Dony Indra; Erwanti, Marlinda Oktavia; Santoso, Audrey (October 2, 2018). "Geger Cerita Ratna Sarumpaet Mengaku Dianiaya". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Ratna Sarumpaet admitted that she had lied about the assault claim, later stating that she is "the best hoax creator", causing widespread condemnation.

links.text: -Purba, David Oliver (October 3, 2018). Rastika, Icha (ed.). "Pernyataan Lengkap Ratna Sarumpaet yang Mengaku Berbohong Dianiaya". Kompas. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Indonesian police arrested Ratna Sarumpaet for disinformation.

links.text: -Rizqo, Kanavino Ahmad (October 5, 2018). "Ratna Sarumpaet Resmi Ditahan". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: KPK arrested Mayor of Pasuruan Setiyono due to an alleged corruption case.

links.text: -Gabrillin, Abba (October 5, 2018). Asril, Sabrina (ed.). "Wali Kota Pasuruan Ditahan KPK". Kompas. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 4 people were killed and 26 people were injured after a strong 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck Situbondo Regency, East Java.

links.text: -Romadoni, Mohammad (October 11, 2018). Permata, Titis Jati (ed.). "Begini Kondisi Korban dan Situasi Terbaru di Pulau Sapudi Sumenep Madura Pasca Gempa Bumi". Tribun News. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 22 people died and many are missing after heavy floods and landslides in Sumatra, Indonesia.

-"At least 22 dead in Indonesia floods and landslides – Channel NewsAsia". Archived from the original on October 13, 2018. Retrieved October 13, 2018.-

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (October 15, 2018). "KPK Tangkap Bupati Bekasi Tersangka Suap Meikarta". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

links.text: -"Bos Lippo Billy Sindoro Ditahan KPK Terkait Suap Meikarta". CNN Indonesia. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 3 people were arrested in Garut after a video showed the burning of a tawhid flag.

links.text: -Ghani, Hakim (October 22, 2018). "Polisi Amankan 3 Orang Terkait Pembakaran Bendera Tauhid di Garut". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Former Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs Rizal Ramli reported a possible massive corruption case of rice imports and other food imports.

links.text: -Fadhil, Haris (October 24, 2018). "Kena OTT, Bupati Cirebon dan 6 Orang Dibawa ke KPK Malam Ini". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: A twister swept through the city of Palembang, damaging multiple structures including a venue in Jakabaring Sport City and a LRT station.

links.text: -Hidayat, Faiq (October 27, 2018). "KPK Tahan 3 Anggota DPRD Kalteng Tersangka Suap". Detik. Retrieved January 28, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Lion Air Flight 610 dived into the Java Sea shortly after taking off from Soekarno-Hatta International Airport, killing all 189 passengers and crews on board in the second deadliest aviation disaster in Indonesian history.

links.text: -Hashim, Firdaus (October 29, 2018). "Lion Air 737 Max 8 crash confirmed, 189 dead". Flight Global. Retrieved May 23, 2023.-

Data.event_text: KPK arrested a high-profile member of National Mandate Party, Taufik Kurniawan, and the Regent of Kebumen Regency, Muhamad Yahya Fuad, for alleged bribery of Rp3.65 billion rupiah.

links.text: -Irawan, Dhani (October 30, 2018). "Berawal dari OTT KPK, Ini Jejak Kasus yang Jerat Taufik Kurniawan". Detik. Retrieved January 29, 2021.-

Data.event_text: Presidential hopeful Prabowo Subianto apologized to the public after his controversial "Boyolali face" remarks, which was regarded as an insult to people from Boyolali.

links.text: -Zhacky, Mochamad (November 6, 2018). "Prabowo Minta Maaf soal 'Tampang Boyolali'". Detik. Retrieved January 29, 2021.-

Data.event_text: At least 3 people were killed after an incident during the performance of "Surabaya Membara".

links.text: -Baihaqi, Amir (November 9, 2018). "Insiden Drama Surabaya Membara, 3 Penonton Tewas". Detik. Retrieved January 30, 2021.-

Data.event_text: KPK stated that a discrepancy between two data on coal sector potentially have caused the government to lose a total of Rp1.3 trillion rupiah.

links.text: -"KPK: Potensi Kerugian Negara karena Beda Data Batu Bara Rp 1,3 T". Detik. Retrieved January 30, 2021.-

links.text: -Safitri, Eva (November 18, 2018). "KPK Tetapkan Bupati Pakpak Bharat Jadi Tersangka". Detik. Retrieved January 30, 2021.-

links.text: -"32 Rumah di Probolinggo Rata dengan Tanah Diterjang Puting Beliung". Detik. Retrieved January 30, 2021.-

Data.event_text: More than 420 people were killed after a tsunami struck the Indonesian province of Banten and Lampung. The tsunami was caused by the collapse of the Anak Krakatoa volcano following eruptions that had happened for days prior to the disaster.

links.text: -"Deadly 'volcano tsunami' hits Indonesia". BBC News. December 23, 2018. Retrieved December 23, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Province of Bali becomes the first province in Indonesia to ban single-use plastics.

links.text: -Fiansyah, Rahmat, ed. (December 24, 2018). "Bali Jadi Provinsi Pertama yang Melarang Plastik Sekali Pakai". iNews. Retrieved July 5, 2020.-
